titleStmt.title: The west-country wonder: or, William the serving-man's good fortune in the marriage of an ancient lady, whom he got with child when she was threescore and six o[r] seven years of age, tho' she had ne'er been with child before, to the joy of her, and the admiration of others. To the tune of, The guinnea wins her. Licensed according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Blare on London-bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
